title: Bank Gothic alternatives
content:
Hi all,

I keep seeing a font that is very similar to bank gothic over the past year or so, but of course I cant find it at the moment.

Just wondering if anyone has some alternatives for bank gothic.

I've found  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/fontlist/alternatives/bank\_gothic/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215061141/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontlist/alternatives/bank_gothic/ "http://www.fontshop.com/fontlist/alternatives/bank\_gothic/")

Any others would be great
author: TF22Raptor

comments.content:
Could it be the newish Dan Reynolds cut?

[http://www.linotype.com/en/5323/theoriginalsquaredsansredrawnbankgothica...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215061141/http:/www.linotype.com/en/5323/theoriginalsquaredsansredrawnbankgothicandmorrissans.html "http://www.linotype.com/en/5323/theoriginalsquaredsansredrawnbankgothicandmorrissans.html")

The original squared sans?  
Hardly.  
Morris Benton not exactly known for originality.  
Most of his "original" typefaces (Hobo, Broadway, &c.) were derived from lettering styles.  
There were square sans faces in the 19th century, known as chamfered.

Guys I think this could be the one I was looking out for (used in the credits of the film Surrogates.)

[http://wtf2.myfonts.com/uploads/images/89/891be798e3ceb792db1c02d2477989...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215061141/http:/wtf2.myfonts.com/uploads/images/89/891be798e3ceb792db1c02d247798981.13351.jpeg "http://wtf2.myfonts.com/uploads/images/89/891be798e3ceb792db1c02d247798981.13351.jpeg")

Any ideas?
